intro: Capsella bursa-pastoris f. arachnoidea, commonly known as the "mouse-ear" or "pea苗", is a variant of the common weeds. It is characterized by its hairy, small leaves and distinctive seed pods. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural fields. It has a short life cycle, completing its growth within a single growing season. The f. arachnoidea form is distinguished by its dense, woolly covering, which gives it a unique appearance.
